div.p:
My completed projects involved designing hypothesis-driven computational methods to glean more information from bacterial taxonomic survey data than comes across in standard analyses.
In microbial ecology experiments, it's important to include a control, since there are "bottle effects" that can make the results difficult to interpret. I designed a method for normalizing OTU count data and visualizing community dynamics while taking account of bottle effects.
In natural ecosystems, it can be difficult to determine ecological relationships. Microbial ecology has historically relied on co-cultures of known laboratory strains. In one of my projects, I made a model of microbial metabolism in a complex ecosystem and linked that to a taxonomic survey to infer relationships between bacteria in situ.

And I have a lot of other interests!
Environmental microbial ecology
Human skin flora
Relationships between human gut microbotia and immune cell repetoires
Experimental design
Effect of salt on the mammalian gut microbiome
